info.title: NIAEFEUP Website - Backend API specification
info.description:
This specification documents the available endpoints and possible operations on the website's backend.
For each of the operations, its purpose, security, requests and possible responses are documented.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for authentication management.

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for account management.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for event management.

tags.name: Posts
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for post management.

tags.name: Projects
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for project management.

get.description: The operation returns an array of accounts, allowing to easily retrieve all the created accounts.

post.description: This endpoint operation creates new accounts.

get.description: This endpoint allows the retrieval of a single account using its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the account to retrieve

get.description: This endpoint operation allows to check if a given access token is valid, returning the associated account's email.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer authentication token

auth/CheckToken/should fail when access.value: {"errors":[{"message":"An error occurred while attempting to decode the Jwt: Invalid JWT serialization: Missing dot delimiter(s)"}]}

post.description: This endpoint operation allows authentication using user's password and email, generating new access and refresh tokens to be used in later communication.
This endpoint operation allows the renewal of access tokens when expiring, using the appropriate refresh token.

get.description:
The operation returns an array of events, allowing to easily retrieve all the created events.
This is useful for example in the frontend's event page, where events are displayed.

events/GetAllEvents/should return all ev.value: [{"title":"Great event","description":"This was a nice and iconic event","teamMembers":[{"name":"Test Account","email":"test_account@test.com","bio":"This is a test account","birthDate":"28-07-2001","photoPath":"https://test-photo.com","linkedin":"https://linkedin.com","github":"https://github.com","websites":[{"url":"https://test-website.com","iconPath":"https://test-website.com/logo.png","id":1}],"roles":[],"id":1}],"registerUrl":"https://docs.google.com/forms","dateInterval":{"startDate":"28-07-2022","endDate":"30-07-2022"},"location":"FEUP","category":"Great Events","thumbnailPath":"https://example.com/exampleThumbnail","associatedRoles":[],"id":1},{"title":"Bad event","description":"This event was a failure","teamMembers":[],"dateInterval":{"startDate":"27-10-2021"},"thumbnailPath":"https://example.com/exampleThumbnail2","associatedRoles":[],"id":2}]

post.description: This endpoint operation creates new events.

events/ThumbnailPathValidation/should no.value: {"title":"Great event","description":"This was a nice and iconic event","dateInterval":{"startDate":"28-07-2022","endDate":"30-07-2022"},"thumbnailPath":""}

get.description:
This endpoint allows the retrieval of a single event using its ID.
It might be used to generate the specific event page.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the event to retrieve

events/GetEvent/should return the event.value: {"title":"Great event","description":"This was a nice and iconic event","teamMembers":[{"name":"Test Account","email":"test_account@test.com","bio":"This is a test account","birthDate":"28-07-2001","photoPath":"https://test-photo.com","linkedin":"https://linkedin.com","github":"https://github.com","websites":[{"url":"https://test-website.com","iconPath":"https://test-website.com/logo.png","id":1}],"roles":[],"id":1}],"registerUrl":"https://docs.google.com/forms","dateInterval":{"startDate":"28-07-2022","endDate":"30-07-2022"},"location":"FEUP","category":"Great Events","thumbnailPath":"https://example.com/exampleThumbnail","associatedRoles":[],"id":1}

put.description: Update previously created events, using their ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the events to update

{"title":"Great event","description":"This was a nice and iconic event","dateInterval":{"startDate":"28-07-2022","endDate":"30-07-2022"}}

delete.description: This operation deletes an event using its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the event to delete

get.description:
This endpoint allows the retrieval of events labeled with a given category.
It might be used to filter events in the event page.
get.operationId: events/GetEventsByCategory/should return all events of the category

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Category of the events to retrieve

events/GetEventsByCategory/should return.value: [{"title":"Great event","description":"This was a nice and iconic event","teamMembers":[],"registerUrl":"https://docs.google.com/forms","dateInterval":{"startDate":"28-07-2022","endDate":"30-07-2022"},"location":"FEUP","category":"Great Events","thumbnailPath":"https://example.com/exampleThumbnail","associatedRoles":[],"id":1},{"title":"Cool event","description":"This event was a awesome","teamMembers":[{"name":"Test Account","email":"test_account@test.com","bio":"This is a test account","birthDate":"28-07-2001","photoPath":"https://test-photo.com","linkedin":"https://linkedin.com","github":"https://github.com","websites":[{"url":"https://test-website.com","iconPath":"https://test-website.com/logo.png","id":1}],"roles":[],"id":1}],"dateInterval":{"startDate":"11-09-2022"},"category":"Great Events","thumbnailPath":"https://example.com/exampleThumbnail2","associatedRoles":[],"id":4}]

put.description: This operation adds a member to a given event.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: ID of the event to add the member to

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: ID of the account to add

put.description: This operation removes a member of a given event.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: ID of the event to remove the member from

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: ID of the account to remove

events/RemoveTeamMember/should remove a.value: {"title":"Great event","description":"This was a nice and iconic event","teamMembers":[],"registerUrl":"https://docs.google.com/forms","dateInterval":{"startDate":"28-07-2022","endDate":"30-07-2022"},"location":"FEUP","category":"Great Events","thumbnailPath":"https://example.com/exampleThumbnail","associatedRoles":[],"id":1}

get.description: The operation returns an array of posts, allowing to easily retrieve all the created posts.

posts/GetAllPosts/should return all post.value: [{"title":"New test released","body":"this is a test post","thumbnailPath":"https://thumbnails/test.png","publishDate":"23-02-2023","lastUpdatedAt":"23-02-2023 19:21:38","id":1,"slug":"new-test-released"},{"title":"NIAEFEUP gets a new president","body":"New president promised to buy new chairs","thumbnailPath":"https://thumbnails/pres.png","publishDate":"23-02-2023","lastUpdatedAt":"23-02-2023 19:21:38","id":2}]

post.description: This endpoint operation creates new posts.

get.description:
This endpoint allows the retrieval of a single post using its ID.
It might be used to generate the specific post page.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the post to retrieve

put.description: Update previously created posts, using their ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the post to update

posts/ThumbnailValidation/should be requ.value: {"title":"New test released","body":"this is a test post"}

posts/ThumbnailValidation/should not be.value: {"title":"New test released","body":"this is a test post","thumbnailPath":""}

posts/BodyValidation/size.value: {"errors":[{"message":"size must be greater or equal to 10","param":"body","value":"aaaaaaaaa"}]}

delete.description: This operation deletes an event using its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the post to delete

get.description:
This endpoint allows the retrieval of a single post using its slug.
It might be used to generate the specific post page.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: Short and friendly textual post identifier

get.description:
The operation returns an array of projects, allowing to easily retrieve all the created projects.
This is useful for example in the frontend project page, where projects are displayed.

projects/GetAllProjects/should return al.value: [{"title":"Awesome project","description":"this is a test project","teamMembers":[{"name":"Test Account","email":"test_account@test.com","bio":"This is a test account","birthDate":"28-07-2001","photoPath":"https://test-photo.com","linkedin":"https://linkedin.com","github":"https://github.com","websites":[{"url":"https://test-website.com","iconPath":"https://test-website.com/logo.png","id":1}],"roles":[],"id":1}],"isArchived":false,"technologies":["Java","Kotlin","Spring"],"associatedRoles":[],"id":1},{"title":"NIJobs","description":"Job platform for students","teamMembers":[],"isArchived":false,"technologies":["ExpressJS","React"],"associatedRoles":[],"id":2}]

post.description: This endpoint operation creates new projects.

events/CreateProject/should create a new.value: {"title":"Awesome project","description":"this is a test project","teamMembers":[{"name":"Test Account","email":"test_account@test.com","bio":"This is a test account","birthDate":"28-07-2001","photoPath":"https://test-photo.com","linkedin":"https://linkedin.com","github":"https://github.com","websites":[{"url":"https://test-website.com","iconPath":"https://test-website.com/logo.png","id":1}],"roles":[],"id":1}],"isArchived":false,"technologies":["Java","Kotlin","Spring"],"associatedRoles":[],"id":2}

get.description:
This endpoint allows the retrieval of a single project using its ID.
It might be used to generate the specific project page.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the project to retrieve

projects/GetProject/should return the pr.value: {"title":"Awesome project","description":"this is a test project","teamMembers":[{"name":"Test Account","email":"test_account@test.com","bio":"This is a test account","birthDate":"28-07-2001","photoPath":"https://test-photo.com","linkedin":"https://linkedin.com","github":"https://github.com","websites":[{"url":"https://test-website.com","iconPath":"https://test-website.com/logo.png","id":1}],"roles":[],"id":1}],"isArchived":false,"technologies":["Java","Kotlin","Spring"],"associatedRoles":[],"id":1}

put.description: Update previously created projects, using their ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the project to update

delete.description: This operation deletes an projects using its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the project to delete

put.description:
This endpoint updates projects as archived. This is useful to mark no longer
maintained or complete projects of the Nucleus.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the project to archive

projects/ArchiveProject/should archive t.value: {"title":"Awesome project","description":"this is a test project","teamMembers":[{"name":"Test Account","email":"test_account@test.com","bio":"This is a test account","birthDate":"28-07-2001","photoPath":"https://test-photo.com","linkedin":"https://linkedin.com","github":"https://github.com","websites":[{"url":"https://test-website.com","iconPath":"https://test-website.com/logo.png","id":1}],"roles":[],"id":1}],"isArchived":true,"technologies":["Java","Kotlin","Spring"],"associatedRoles":[],"id":1}

put.description:
This endpoint updates projects as unarchived.
This is useful to mark previously unarchived projects as active.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the project to unarchive

put.description: This operation add a member to a given project.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: ID of the project to add the member to

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: ID of the account to add

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: ID of the project to remove the member from

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: ID of the account to remove
